p: Together with joint inflammation, cartilage degradation also takes place in CHIKV infected individuals. In humans, the presence of elevated levels of cartilage bioproducts in urine (i.e., proline, hydroxyproline, and mucopolysaccarides) [ 160], and the low levels of the plasmatic of hepatocyte growth factor (HGF; hormone facilitating cartilage repairs) in chronic patients [ 122], are indicative of connective tissue alteration and cartilage damage. In mouse models of CHIKV-induced arthritis, the destruction of cartilage and the formation of large areas of collagenosis and fibrosis were observed [ 125, 161, 162]. A direct effect of CHIKV on cartilage is suggested by viral replication in human primary chondrocytes [ 86] and in CHIKV inoculated immunodeficient (IRF3/7 −/−) mice [ 145].
